Trails.Name: Lost in the Woods (Lower) Uphill Route
Lost in the Woods (Upper) Uphill Route

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Tuesday, February 17, 2026 8:25 AM Due to very deep snow, all lift operations will be delayed to no earlier than 10:00AM. Stay tuned for further updates as our teams assess conditions. Rolling openings this morning will be limited to lower-mountain lifts out of Canyon and Eagle Lodges. Main Lodge is closed, with no lifts operating in that zone. Powder is front and center today, with 2739 inches of new snow in the past 24 hours and more on the way. Due to strong winds and ongoing snowfall, 8 lifts are expected to operate today, conditions permitting. See below for a full list. If you would prefer a voucher for your tickets or activities today, submit an Activity Change request or call 800.MAMMOTH. Please remember to stay close to your group, give trees plenty of space, and avoid riding solo. Snowmobile Adventures, Tamarack Cross-Country Ski Center, and the Coaster at Woolly's Adventure Summit are all closed today.
  
Upcoming Storm Cycle Expectations: Please review our updated storm cycle procedure, new this year. Continued operational impacts are expected tomorrow, with heavy snowfall and strong winds forecasted.  
Conditions: 27-39 inches of new snow in the last 24 hours. Heavy snowfall, strong SW winds, and temps in the teens. Temps on the hill will feel colder today due to below zero wind chills. 
Visibility: Heavy snowfall and gusty winds may lead to low visibility at times. If you feel disoriented, stop in a safe location and take a moment to re-orient by looking at a distant object before continuing.  
Lift status: 8 lifts are expected to spin no earlier than 10:00 AM, with rolling openings to Roller Coaster Express (4), Chair 7, Chair 8, Eagle Express (15), Schoolyard Express (17), Chair 20, Chair 21, and the Village Gondola, conditions permitting. Lifts will not operate out of Main Lodge. 
Safety: Deep snow remains a serious factor today. The risk of Snow Immersion Suffocation (SIS) is real, so avoid tree wells and deep snow near trees. Always ski or ride with a partner, keep your group in sight, and stay alert for obstacles beneath new snowfall. Visit our Safety page for more tips. Our on-mountain emergency hotline is: 760.934.0611
Road Conditions: Heavy snowfall today is making roads snowy and icy. High winds may kick up light powder, reducing visibility. Consider taking the free Mountain Shuttle this morning. If driving, please drive with caution and allow extra space. Check our Road Conditions page for the latest status.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport:
Deep Snow Safety: Stay within sight of your group, give trees plenty of space, and avoid riding solo. Obstacles may exist beneath new snow, so ski and ride with caution.
On-mountain emergency hotline: 760.934.0611
